grafanaDescription: The username and password of the Grafana user to be able to collect data for reports.
grafana_url_description: The URL of the Grafana instance
emailDescription: The username and password of the email account from which to send emails from.
saveDetailsDescription: Save and update the newly added information.
delete_report_group_question: Are you sure you want to delete this report group?
name: Name
report_interval_description: The interval frequency for emails to be sent
report_group_description: The reporting group assigned to this schedule
choose_stores: Choose stores for which this report should be run for
lookback_period_description: The amount of time to lookback for reports
selected_stores_description: The stores for which this the report should be run for
datasource_details: Select the datasource where your mSupply data is held.
email_port_description: The port of the email address from which to send emails from.
email_host_description: The host of the email address from which to send emails from.
variables_tooltip: These are the variables which are used within this panels query. They are created within the panels dashboard settings - view that for more information.
edit_details_report_group_tooltip: Edit the details of this report group here.
edit_details_schedule_tooltip: Edit the details of this report schedule here.
available_panels_tooltip: This is a list of all panels which are available to be added as a sheet within an emailed report. They are panels created within any dashboard of your Grafana instance with a few requirements. Panels must use a table format, and must only use variables which are either a query or custom type. For query type variables, the datasource must be the same datasource as defined in this mSupply app configuration.
users_tooltip: Select a user who should be a part of this reporting group and receive emails from any report schedule assigned this group. Only users who have an email entered into your mSupply instance can be selected.
